lines.gurmukhi: cMdn smIp bis bwNs mihmwN n jwnI Awn dRum dUr Bey bwsnw kY bohy hY
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Sameep Basi Baans Mahimaan N Jaanee , Aan Droum Door Bhaay Baasanaa Kai Bohay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a bamboo has not known the merits of a sandalwood tree having lived near it, but other trees though far away from it still acquire its fragrance.

lines.gurmukhi: dwdr srovr mYN jwnY n kml giq mkrMd kir mDkr hI ibmohy hY
lines.transliteration_english: Daadar Sarovar Main Jaanai N Kamal Gati , Makarand Kari Madhakar Hee Bimohay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A frog knows not the goodness of a lotus flower though it stays in the same pond, but bumble bees are crazy of the nectar that is stored in these flowers.

lines.gurmukhi: sursrI ibKY bg jwnRXo n mrm kCU Awvq hY jwqRI jMqR jwqRw hyq sohy hY
lines.transliteration_english: Surasaree Bikhai Bag Jaanyo N Maram Kachhoo , Aavat Hai Jaatree Jantr Jaatraa Hayt Sohay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: An egret living in the waters of river Ganges does not know the importance of that water, but many people come to the river Ganges on a pilgrimage and feel honoured.

lines.gurmukhi: inkt bsq mm gur aupdys hIn dUr hI idsMqr aur AMqr lY pohy hY ]639]
lines.transliteration_english: Nikat Basat Mam Gur Oupadays Heena , Door Hee Disantar Ur Antar Lai Pohay Hai ?639?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, though I live near the True Guru, I am bereft of the knowledge of His advice whereas people from far off places come to the True Guru, obtain His sermon and abides it in their heart. (639)
